publishers
Class LastSalePublisher

java.lang.Object
  publishers.LastSalePublisher

public final class LastSalePublisher
extends java.lang.Object

This class consists of methods that allow a User to subscribe or unsubscibe to get information about last sale for a stock, and a method that sends out last sale updates.

Author:
Urvi

Method Summary
static LastSalePublisher getInstance()
          Returns the only instance of the LastSalePublisher that will be used throughout the system.
 void publishLastSale(java.lang.String product, Price p, int v)
          Sends out last sale information to all users who have subscribed to a specified stock.

          Subscribes a user to receive last sale information for a given stock.
 void unSubscribe(User user, java.lang.String prod)

getInstance

public static LastSalePublisher getInstance()
                                     throws InvalidArgumentException
Returns the only instance of the LastSalePublisher that will be used throughout the system.

Returns:
A LastSalePublisher instance

See Also:
LastSalePublisherImplFactory.getPublisher(publishers.IPublisher.PubType)

subscribe

public void subscribe(User user,
                      java.lang.String prod)
               throws AlreadySubscribedException,
                      InvalidArgumentException
Subscribes a user to receive last sale information for a given stock.

Parameters:
user - User who wishes to subscribe.
prod - Product symbol for which User wants current market information
Throws:
AlreadySubscribedException - if user is already subscribed to the product
InvalidArgumentException - if user or prod is null

unSubscribe

public void unSubscribe(User user,
                        java.lang.String prod)
                 throws NotSubscribedException,
                        InvalidArgumentException
Unsubscribes a user from receiving last sale information for a given stock.

Parameters:
user - User who wishes to unsubscribe.
prod - Product symbol for which User no longer wants last sale information
Throws:
NotSubscribedException - if user was not subscribed to the product
InvalidArgumentException - if user or prod is null

publishLastSale

public void publishLastSale(java.lang.String product,
                            Price p,
                            int v)
                     throws InvalidArgumentException
Sends out last sale information to all users who have subscribed to a specified stock. *

Parameters:
product - Stock symbol user is subscribed to.
p - Last sale price of the stock symbol user is subscribed to.
v - Last volume for the stock symbol user is subscribed to.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if p or v is null
